concise_definition: n. 喉咙, 喉部; v. (口语) 咽下, 喉咙发出声音

definitions.explanation_en: The part of the body that connects the mouth and nose to the esophagus and lungs, involved in breathing, swallowing, and speaking.
definitions.explanation_cn: 连接口腔和鼻腔与食道及肺部的身体部位，参与呼吸、吞咽和发声。
definitions.example_en: She had a sore throat and could barely speak.
definitions.example_cn: 她喉咙痛，几乎说不出话来。

definitions.explanation_en: A narrow passage or constriction, often used metaphorically to describe a tight or confined space.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指狭窄的通道或收窄处，常用于比喻形容狭窄或受限的空间。
definitions.example_en: The ship navigated through the narrow throat of the harbor.
definitions.example_cn: 船只驶过了港口狭窄的入口。

definitions.explanation_en: (Informal) To swallow something quickly or forcefully, often with difficulty.
definitions.explanation_cn: (口语) 快速或勉强地咽下某物，常带有困难或不适感。
definitions.example_en: He throated the pill without water.
definitions.example_cn: 他没喝水就把药片咽了下去。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a sound with the throat, such as a growl or a grunt, often expressing emotion or discomfort.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用喉咙发出声音，如低吼或咕哝，常表达情绪或不适。
definitions.example_en: The dog throated a warning as the stranger approached.
definitions.example_cn: 当陌生人靠近时，狗用喉咙发出警告的低吼。

comparison.analysis: “Gullet” (食道) 是解剖学上更精确的术语，专指连接咽部与胃的肌肉管道，仅用于吞咽功能。而 “throat” 是更通用的日常用语，涵盖咽部、喉部及发音器官，范围更广。
“Larynx” (喉头) 是解剖学中特指包含声带的结构，主要负责发声。而 “throat” 是一个更宽泛的解剖区域，包括咽、喉、部分气管，不仅涉及发声，还包括呼吸和吞咽。
“Neck” (脖子) 指头部与躯干之间的整个外部结构，包含肌肉、骨骼、血管和皮肤，是一个外部可见的部位。而 “throat” 是颈部内部的通道，主要指功能性的管道区域，不包括外部皮肤和肌肉组织。
